comment: I bought this PC after about a year of wanting to build/buy a PC. My original thought was to build my own, but after picking out everything I wanted on PC Part Picker, the build was about $200 more than this build (and I was trying to build with an i5 processor as well). I will say that my build might have been more expensive because I was trying to get a nice motherboard and PSU, and I do believe that this PC has a lower-end brand. Regardless, it's working as intended.The PC worked well out of the box and the fans and case look great with the RGB. If you are not RGB inclined, it is easy to turn off as well. The games look great and I was able to load into heavily computational games (such as 6+ player Civ VI) very quickly. I have played the following games in the week that I've had it: Civilization VI, Rainbow Six: Siege, Divinity: Original Sin 2, and Fallout: New Vegas. All of the games run smoothly and look great. The PC is pretty quiet - you can hear the fans a little bit if you have no sound on at all, but it is negligible once you are listening to something and it is impossible to hear if you have a headset on.

The machine arrived without any problems, could load up and boot quickly. Would've liked more detailed information. For example, had to download the drivers for the graphics cards and others.You get two DVDs with drivers, but the machine doesn't have a DVD and I don't have anywhere that can read them. And no instructions.

My first official gaming tower PC, wife got it for me for Christmas (Cyber Monday Deal). Arrived at my door in one piece with no damage to the box itself (shout out to USPS for that much).Enjoying it very much, a lot of my steam library is now running at 4K 60FPS Max settings. It’s a beast of a machine. Already have the 1Tb SDD almost completely full, looking to expand on that with an internal SSD of 2 or 4TB.

I bought this computer for my husband, a computer scientist, because he determined after extensive research that this machine would be powerful enough to run machine learning programs.  The combination of the powerful graphics card and the overall value clinched it, but of course it also needed the fans to cool down the CPU during high intensity use that you'd find either with gaming or the type of programs he runs/programs. He partitioned the drive to keep Windows but to mostly run Linux.  So far, the computer has run smoothly (there were a few minor hitches in the beginning) without overheating.We keep the computer on the floor with full air circulation around it because we feared placing it under the desk might lead to fan failure due to overworking.  Yes, it looks cool with all the colors in the see-through box, but it also reminds you of how many fans this machine needs.  The specs are high-end for the price but not truly high-end.  This computer offers a great value for the specs.  Because the drive is solid state, everything runs off it is faster than a non-gaming computer: gaming, streaming, and high-data programs.

This puppy came in today...got it setup then installed a Toshiba 8 TB... My best download Mbps was185...average download speed is around 135 Mbps. This is my second Cyberpowerpc, first one is almost 3 1/2 years old and still kicking.Update 9/4/2019: Motherboard utility was not installed so I have to do a temporary hook up of a DVD to load the utilities into the PC.

Purchased this as a Black Friday deal which was $250 less than normal price. Surprisingly, it arrived the next day. I paired this with a 32" 1440p 144 Hz monitor. While Amazon provides the specs, the specific manufacturers of the different components were not advertised, perhaps to give Cyberpower more leeway in their supply chain. The graphics card was from Gigabyte which is good. The mother board was ASRock Z390 Phantom Gaming 4-CB. The 16GB of memory are set to 2666 even though Amazon shows 2400. With the liquid cooling and only an SSD drive, the system is relatively quiet (just the 3 main fans). The cabling is minimal and neatly organized. The system worked well right out of the box.This is my second Cyberpower system -- while I was quite happy with my prior one, I was annoyed that using a small SSD plus large HDD is challenging for Windows as it insists on putting all your personal files (eg. Documents) on the C drive which fills up quickly. You can work around it, which I did, but it forces you to have separate folders on C and D and to always remember to select the one you wanted (which is D, whereas Windows really wants you to pick C). Anyways, that problem is solved with this system by foregoing the HDD altogether.
SLC8260A2Windows 10 Home

You think you're getting a pretty good gaming pc. It will work just fine for about three months. Then BOOM need to reinstall windows. Ok, no biggie. A week later it again needed boot media. Ok, reinstall.A week later it happens again. So I contact Amazon tech support. The return window had just passed so there was nothing they could do. So here I am, nearly 2k wasted. Seriously, you'd have better luck gaming on a literal pile of dog poop.

After waiting many years my older i7-4820k was showing signs of its aging technology. I’m sure I could have gone a few more years with it but since I do CAD work, I also wanted to improve my 2 27” monitors showing the 3D graphics and expand using a 3rd 4k monitor. I knew my old 4GB GTX970 graphics card wouldn’t do the job as well. I first spent about a full day pricing out a new build at 3 different web sites and no matter how I did it which would have to include my labor, I couldn’t beat the price of this Liquid Cooled Cyberpower PC that had the i7-9700k CPU. It has little room to expand adding more fans and another video card. Search Onyxia II 242W Mid Tower Gaming case; emulates many other cases sold here on Amazon like FSP ATX Mid tower. Expandable yet only has room in either remaining drive bays of 2X3.5” OR 2X2.5” and it badly needs more USB ports. I use a 6TB external drive so I didn’t need the 1TB SS drive, too big and wish they had used the Optane Drive feature this MB is capable of when they built it but I can add up to 2 more M.2 type to this board if M key. Did order more RAM to double the 16GB DD4 3000MHz RAM it came with but seems to always have 10GB free anyway. No DVD RW in this but these days don’t need it; I do have an external portable USB type anyway. I have figured out how to OC the video card using the FireStorm software I got from their site. Just try and price out these parts alone. Just the Video Card, is 500 bucks on average and the CPU is around 400 bucks and this is not the 300 series 9th Generation CPU which scores less in performance I read. But this is how the unit bench-marked when I got it.Benchmark 2020-01-25

i bought this for my boyfriend for his birthday, along with an extra fan in case he had heat issues like some other reviews said. however, he has not had any heat issues whatsoever and is extremely happy with it. he plays games like monster hunter, destiny2, and others on 4k and at the highest settings, all running perfectly.it came with an addressable RBG thing.. just ignore that, if you're not experienced with building computers. just know that you dont need it to make the RBG's work, its basically just to control the RBGs through your computer instead of the little remote you get. 100% ignore it because it will only make you confused haha.
I Hope i can give 0 stars for this computer.When i tried to turn on the computer.
The Good:Price: A little better than PCpartpicker components as of 8-29-2019, better if on sale

I'll start by saying I have over 35 years of IT experience, specifically DIY PC's, gaming rigs and servers. It's because of my love for gaming that I naturally gravitated to a professional career.So because of the significance of cost vs value I felt I needed to share this so others with perhaps less experience will be aware of what they're about to buy.

I know pre-built machines come with some anxiety over the parts lottery, but I snagged this on a deal expecting to have to upgrade a few things and fix the fans and cable setup. Here are my thoughts:1 - The box arrived quickly and was decently packed.

Everything arrived in working condition. Components are correct when comparing with the specs listed. Secure packaging and the wiring is clean.Performance this is a very fast machine, have tried multiple games and it easily handles them.
I'm going to summarize what a lot of folks have already commented on and give you the specs.1. GOOD VALUE - This computer was an awesome deal with it's on-sale price.

The computer came in a box which delivered  in good condition.  After taking it out, the computer had no scratches or defects on visual inspection.  The graphics card, ram, Bluetooth adapter card and CPU were all correctly installed and fit in their place snuggly.  All the fans worked as the picture shows and it looks really nice.  It worked right out of the box as promised.  I updated the firmware for the motherboard because I saw others had issues with clock speeds.  The CD with some drivers wasn’t needed because ASUS website had all the drivers for everything.  The graphics card is from Gigabyte and is a 3 fan style model.  It has one mini display port two regular display ports and one regular HDMI port.  Despite all the fans in it, it is amazingly quiet.  So no issue there.Now the not so great.  The only issues I have are for the wiring, the power supply, the lack of ports for expansion, and the lack of sufficient cooling as a whole.

Negatives: Lights on the fans / cpu liquid cooling went out after the second day. Wifi card seemed to cut in and out as well, so ended up having to get an external one to fix that issue.Positives: Lightning fast. Pretty sleek spots for 2.5 SSD drives (so sleek in fact, that I didn't realize what they were for until after I attached them to brackets). Overall a great value for the price... I just get a little worried about having two things go wrong before the one month return window hits. Hopefully nothing else happens, but all and all barring anything else going wrong, I'm very happy with my purchase.
It's Monday night and this monster arrived last Thursday night.Pros:

Sorry, spending $1500 on a PC to get a rattling tower back fan ruins this. There's another user review here showing himself screwing the back of the case to fix it. I tried that, it did not work. I called tech support, they sent me a tutorial on the front fans, I said it was the back CPU fan.I bought this $1500 pc with brand new everything precisely to not have to dig into the inside. What a let down that cheap components, APEVIA are the fans included were used.  Then the tech guy Raymond says I'd have to take the PC to best buy to get the fan worked on by Geek Squad or 3 weeks to send me a different system.  Oh joy, so I have to pay to fix what should have been tested beforehand?

I had to subtract 1 star.  This is a 5-star machine once it's working properly, but I had so many issues initially that I'm not sure everyone could troubleshoot and fix the way I did, I felt obligated to subtract 1.Pros:
It looks shiny, worked great on the first day.It doesn't turn on anymore on the second day.

Worked great for one night, then it would keep rebooting every 30 seconds or so. So I returned and ordered a replacement.  That one ran great but had a faulty fan that sounded like a buzz saw.  After hours on the phone with amazon and trying to get cyberpower to pick up, nothing resolved.  That’s going back too.

This machine runs everything I have asked it to. I agree with the other reviews about the lack of attention in the build. This problem was caused by a fan striking the plastic shroud to the water cooler. After attempts with CyberpowerPC support (no help) I finally figured out where the noise was coming from, and simply backing the screws out a couple turns gave the clearance needed for the fan within the shroud. The point is this is an expensive desktop, and unless you have the knowledge and aptitude to trouble shoot some things, this may not be the computer for you.

Was available with free 1 day delivery. Great sale price. Arrived on time and well packed. Very clean and pro looking build. The familiar Asus mobo and MSI RTX card made it seem custom built. Window installation was embarrassing simple and it was updated and running in a very short time. So far it is running smooth and error free. It easily runs games at ultra max settings and at 4K resolution! It is practically silent and only spins up when gaming. Overall the case has no overheating issues and the sealed water cooler system is made of metal and not plastic. Very impressive. All in all it is a top end machine that would be difficult to build for the price. The easy set up and price make this a great deal.

The parts they picked are pretty decent, not the best by any means but better than some pre-builds i've seen. Packaging was pretty banged up and had some damage, So i was suspecting to see some damage on the system itself, Sure enough there was some minor damage to the case. The system it self seems to be running fine so far, although in gaming the system tends to run a bit hot, I don't think they did a good job on cooling the system, (might need to add a few more fans), There should have been at least another case fan on top vent. The ram is a bit low as well only 2400MHz (maybe 3000MHz would have been nice). Overall for the special pricing they had running on this for $1199 i can't complain or gripe too much, Only time will tell if the system holds up.

Amazing PC! Picked it up during a lightning sale and the price was relatively cheaper than buying the parts separately. Gone are the days that building your own PC is the cheapest option.Performance is great, benchmarks are top tier. I can run Ultra on every game I own. SSD is speedy, boots up within 5-10 seconds. No complaints here. The RAM is a bit on the slower side but all things considering it gets the job done for gaming. Cable management is good. The temperatures are cool.

I have read a lot of reviews on Cyberpower computers as well as other brands of prebuilds where customers complained about such problems as poor wiring management, cheap no name brand components, improperly configured cooling fans, operating systems not activated and play ready and a host of other problems.  I can only speak to my own experience and in doing so, I have to say that I have experienced none of those things.  The truth is that I pulled this pc out of the box, pulled out the packing foam, checked all the components to see that they were properly seated and then hooked it up to a monitor and to my home network and fired it up.  I have purchased a lot of computers in my life and built quite a few myself and this one was one of the most painless startups I have ever experienced!  everything worked absolutely perfect and the wiring looked very professional.  The components were all good brand names although not top of the line models, very decent when considering the price I paid for the entire package.  I can highly recommend this computer package from CyberPower.  I cannot guaranty that ever pc produce by CyberPower will be as flawless as this one but like I said, I can only speak from my own experience.Dennis

WOW! I don't normally write reviews but I am so impressed by this machine I'd like to share with others. After weeks of reading PC reviews I reluctantly purchased this CYBERPOWERPC Gamer Supreme Liquid Cool Gaming PC, Intel Core i7-9700K 3.6GHz, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2070 S. Received it 2 days ago and set-up went flawlessly. As expected I did have updates to complete which also went well. It takes slightly under 30 seconds for this PC to bootup and the SSD Drive is faster than I imagined. Yesterday I completed loading games including Red Dead Redemption 2 and the performance is amazing. I have built my own PCs in the past and considered doing it this time but I am now happy I didn't. Thanks for saving me from all the frustration Cyberpower!

Positives: RGB looks spectacular. Fans are quiet. Computer is super fast for the price. Great for playing 3A titles at/near max settings.Cons: They give you a recovery CD when the computer has no disk drives??? So basically it's a coaster?

I'll try to find out what exactly is wrong and update the review afterthat.

Unpacked the unit, made the connections and it powered up first time, ran through the Windows initialization, and I was off and gaming.  It took some time to download my first game, Dishonored 2, and it ran beautifully.  I built my last PC and kept it running for 10 years, but it finally gave up.  Looking into building a new one, this system seems to have quite a lot of technology (memory, CPU, graphics) for a decent price.  Similar systems from DELL, HP, and others all seemed higher for the same equipment.  I always had issues with my last PC overheating, but this one keeps nice and cool and makes just a small amount of noise.  I thought the circle lights would be distracting, but unless they are directly in front of you, I like the way it looks, like it's working away as the lights spin.  A remote is included to change the lighting pattern/color or to turn them off.  On the whole, I'm very happy with this purchase.  After a month no issues to report.

So I contacted Cyberpower PC and they offered to receive to replace the CPU but I would have to mail it to them and be without a computer for a couple of weeks.  So.. they gave me a $100 Amazon Gift Card for the trouble.  I'm not exactly happy with the process but I feel better. Have had this for a little over 24 hours now.  Super quiet, stays cool even while playing current AAA titles with the graphics turned up.  No issues yet.  I can honestly say this is the cleanest (most empty) tower ever.  Lots of room for expansion and upgrades.  I really did not want all of the case fan lights but now that I have it, I have to admit that I love them.  There is a remote to shut the lights off if you do not want them on or you can use it to change the colors, speeds, cycles of the lights.  The only (minor) issue was the secondary drive was not setup.  Just a matter of going into disk management and setting it up there, but this could be an issue if it is something you are not familiar with.  In closing, I would definitely recommend this computer.  For the price, this was the best I could find.  My son is about due for a new one and I will likely buy from this same manufacturer for his as well.

I was a little hesitant to buy this gaming PC from some of the reviews, but I figured there is always a risk with any new rig you buy.  Dead parts happen, I am not a pro by any means but I can fix up some things.  Other reviews on what to do really helped with additional mods for this thing.I ordered a few Noctua fans, which, by the way are extremely quiet and efficient.  For the top - grab a 140x25mm fan.  You WILL need to adjust the liquid cooling screws on the back, slide them down while they are loose, and slide the Noctua fan in.  Tighten everything down, good to go.  Just be gentle as the wires come in right near the fan buy, so don't just ram it in there.  If you don't feel comfortable making any adjustments, grab a Noctua slim fan 120x15mm, and it will still mount in there fine.  The holes are for both types of fans.

When I first unboxed and turned on my PC, everything ran great.... for about 30 minutes. That's when I got my first blue screen. What followed was 2 days of endless customer support contact, YouTube videos, and headache. I even highly considered sending the PC back for a refund.However, if you stick through that headache and are able to fix the blue screens, this is an outstanding PC. I currently have mine overclocked at 4.8Ghz and I can play anything on highest settings with 100+FPS easily. Boot and load times are great. During hot summer days while playing demanding games such as AC: Odyssey, I haven't had temps that even hit 80 degrees celsius yet. I do plan on adding more fans for better airflow despite that, just for personal preference.

UPDATE: After a few hours messing around with this thing I'm in love. It's a beast. I can play FSX Steam maxed out at 4K. I attached a screenshot of the benchmark test from Forza Horizon 4. Again, every setting maxed at 4k with HDR and runs consistently over 100 fps. After about an hour of that abuse, GPU was at 72 C, CPU was at 40 C. It's laughed at everything I've thrown at it so far and I have yet to overclock anything. My only disappointment so far is that the mouse they sent arrived broken and I am missing the remote that controls the case LEDs altogether. I went directly to Cybepowerpc's website and their customer service team is happily sending replacements for both. I was pretty disappointed that while Amazon had no issues shipping this entire computer to my FPO box, CyberPowerPC would not let me register the computer using that address nor would they ship the replacement pieces out. It will be real interesting if I ever end up needing to mail it in for warranty issues. Fingers crossed that doesn't happen.Box arrived nested inside another box in great condition. I was worried about ordering this because I am overseas and I've received some seriously beat up boxes through our post office. To my surprise, the outer box was in pretty good shape and the inner box looks perfect. The computer was also very well padded inside the box and there's even packing inside the case itself to keep things from bouncing around. After reading some of the other reviews, I made sure to double-check all connections and all of mine seem to be seated properly and in the right spot. I've plugged it in and the lights came on but unfortunately Amazon hasn't shipped my monitor yet! I'll definitely hook it up to the TV later to check things out but for now my son is watching TV and I wanted to get this thing registered and reviewed so I can get my super sweet mouse pad...I'll update my review later

I ordered this PC for a friend who did not want to build his own PC and while I usually recommend building your own, I was pleasantly surprised by the performance of this machine. The case could have better airflow, but honestly, with most PC cases being about the aesthetic these days, it is not a huge problem considering how nice it looks especially with the amount of RGB fans that are included (the remote for the RGB is something I did not know I needed until I was setting it up for him, super convenient especially if your PC is under your desk but still in view like mine). If you are looking for a PC that can run most if not all games at high settings over 60 FPS @ 1440p, I would really recommend this PC if you are not confident enough to or just don't want to build your own. He is happy with it and I can approve it after tuning the fan speeds in the BIOS.

I live in Puerto Rico, got the computer, and within a month the fan started making terrible noises. Can't get a replacement shipped here, and the tech support is unwilling to help.Avoid this company, avoid this cheaply made computer, I guess I have to keep battling with them to send me a replacement fan! What a waste of time and energy. Do better CyberPower PC. DO BETTER

I like this system, enough that I bought a second one just about 6 months later.And then the ssd hd on the first one stopped being recognized in the first one 11 days later, just 5 days after the base 6 month warranty ran out.

Got this PC about a week ago, great shipping, it was protected to it arrived without any kind of damage. The case and the insides are absolutely beautiful: lots of RGB lights which will make your room look like a club at night, with a remote that allows you to change it to your will. PC is extremely powerful: has great specs for the price and can basically run any game at 1440p or even 4k, with newer and most-demanding games at over 60FPS.Although I'm generally very happy with it, there is one con: the airflow within the case is not great. I've been playing OW lately and the GPU gets to 83°C and throttles down. I've tried downloading AI Suite and turning the fans to the max but even then it eventually throttles. I have bought a couple of fans which I'll install soon, hopefully solving or at least improving the problem.

this thing is a beast for computing and gaming. The only issue was that you have to install an adaptor for the video. there is a 3 hole power supply at 5v that I was searching for and couldn't find. I decided to take the other side panel off to see if the tech that put it together might have mixed up the cables. There it was strapped to other cables. it was also too short, so I had to stick the VGA adapter to that closed side of the PC. not a big deal, but they should have made it simpler. I gave them 4 stars for that mix-up. overall, great PC.

Overall -I'm not an expert at PC's but I'm familiar enough to know that you aren't getting ripped off when you buy this. It runs amazing, it's not loud which is something I guess some people are concerned about. It isn't overpriced as I looked up all of the parts and its around the same price to build (again, not an expert, but from what I've seen this is accurate). You won't be part of the PC building club but you'll save a good amount of time not looking for what goes with what when building, not to mention the time it would take to make this look nice.Performance wise -  I'm coming from a laptop gaming computer from 2010 to this so this desktop is amazing for me. Zero problems with games like Warzone. No complaints whatsoever.

I ordered 2 of these for my sons as Christmas presents.... pre-sales support was great - post sales support has been non-existent.... my emails have gone unanswered, calls to tech support are met with a constant busy signal....Neither of the systems had all the drivers loaded properly, when they boot up we are met with "can not be found" errors from the get go.... so I had to go to the manufacturers site and get the software that was not supplied from CyberPower.... as you can see from the photo... one of the systems only has half of the internal LED lighting even working.... the Liquid Cooled CPU fan does not work and neither does one of the front fans
Pulled the trigger on this when they were running a sale. Cheaper than I could have built it.I posted some of this as a comment to another comment, but thought I re-post here for visibility.

I bought this computer for a great price on Cyber Monday (December 2, 2019). It arrived the next day (faster then advertised) and was in excellent condition. The wires were all tight and connected. The packaging was excellent. WARNING: The box comes clearly marked as a gaming computer, so if you are in an area that this would tempt theft or clue someone in about a gift, I suggest taking steps to prevent that.The computer was pretty-much plug-and-play. I know my way around a computer but am by no means tech-savvy. I was prompted for almost all updates and downloads, which took less than one hour to complete. The machine is quiet and the fans make less noise than a room fan. I have already noticed a HUGE improvement to my game playing.

I'm not a tech wiz or expert by any means, so take this review as coming from an enthusiast who knows the minimum.I believe this to be a very powerful rig. It runs any game I desire (flight sim, Arma 3, The Witcher 3, Modded Minecraft with Ray Tracing/Shaders) at incredible speeds and outstanding graphics quality. I have not experienced any lag or FPS issues in any of my games. The lights are cool, the computer is quiet, and I have nothing bad to say. I'm very happy with my purchase. The only thing I could recommend is to update your drivers manually, because a few of mine were a couple years old and this caused a brief issue. Specifically the wifi adapter driver needed to be updated. It stopped working on my out of nowhere and it took a bit to figure it out, but after updating it I have no issues. So overall, I am highly satisfied with this computer and it's my pride and joy as my first gaming PC.

Very awesome computer, just got it about 2 days ago and so far it’s been awesome, the rgb lights give it a nice feel and makes it look more cool and makes it look more of a gaming computer, so far it’s been doing very well, the price is not to much but it’s definitely not a budget PC this is more of a high tech gaming pc, that can be used for gaming and etc, the pc is very built neatly although some of the plugs get unplugged sometimes while being shipped because of the packaging so just make sure you make sure everything is tightened and plugged in the pc itself has a nice feel and is very cool it comes with a custom cyberpower keyboard and a rgb black mouse, as well as a plugin for the computer obviously, and it does NOT come with an hdmi cable, maybe it might come with one for you but when it arrived I didn’t see any, but it’s not that big of a deal because normally the monitor comes with an hdmi and a display port, the pc runs very well on CSGO, Fortnite, GTA and tons more but that’s all the games I tried it should run as good on any other game I reached around 230 FPS on fortnite and it can even go higher, it’s an awesome pc overall, for gamers, it’s also comes with an led remote to control and change the colors as well as the speed, awesome product.

I got the i9-9900K RTX-2700 version for video editing and 3D animation and I really couldn't be happier.  I had priced out a system with similar specs to build myself and was about ready to pull the trigger when this computer came out for Black Friday and the system was more power for less money than building it.  Plus I wouldn't get all the cool lights (which I don't need in any way, but when I do live streams and tutorials, it makes for a fun added visual element.)Adobe Premiere and Blender and everything else runs faster than it ever has.  I did opt to add more RAM.  Mine came with 16GB in two 8GB sticks.

I received this PC on June 22nd, 2020. It is currently August 4th, 2020, and I think it might finally be able to be used.After it arrived fairly quickly, I used it for one day, before it turned off on its own. After I turned it back on, it turned back off after a few minutes, and wouldn't turn back on. After realizing that the PDF on Amazon's page lists the wrong tech support hours (they close at 6 PM PST now, due to the virus, probably), I finally got ahold of tech support the next day.

So ive built a few pcs in my life and this one is by far the best ive had. I opened it up first just to see the wiring and how they had it set up. Everything was neatly organized and in its place. Installed all my drivers and fired up a few games to see what it would do. I couldnt really be more impressed than i am with it so far. If anything changes i will resubmit my review. Here are a few of my Pros cons so far with the system.Pros- Really fast gaming pc for the price point

I am VERY satisfied with my purchase.  I don’t think there is a better value out there for a desktop PC spec’d like this, or at least I wasn’t able to find it.  Piecing the components together on my own the cheapest I could get was around $1700, and I paid $1300 for this machine before taxes.  Bottom line up front, I recommend this PC to anyone in the market without hesitation and I would buy this PC again in a heartbeat.I've had this PC for just over a week and it's ran nonstop since I've set it up, without a single issue.  I read most of the reviews and was concerned there may be issues when I received mine or that substandard components may have been used (cables unplugged, fans not working, cheap hardware, etc.).  That is not the case with the PC I received.  The case is very well made and has lots of ventilation.  The color fans are pretty cool but were not a contributing factor to my decision but my 11 year old loves them.  The fans are quiet though which is a huge plus.  The MB is an AsRock Z390 Phantom Gaming 4 which has a very friendly BIOS that makes it easy to OC your processor and/or RAM, if that's your thing.  The RAM came as 2 x 8GB sticks of Patriot 3000MHz, the GTX 2070 Super video card is a Gigabyte, and the NVMe SSD is a WD Blue.  Plenty of USB ports on the back and two on the top front of the case and built in Wi-Fi as well as your standard audio in, out, mic jacks, old school mouse and keyboard plugs, and an RJ-45 ethernet connection.  It also has a USB-C port which I've seen on plenty of laptops but am not certain if it's standard equipment on desktops. Some of the reasons listed for bad performance were the usual you would expect: Overheating, voltage throttling, etc. One of the reasons is: You are using an overclockable chip and you are not overclocking. So I did a little research and downloaded the Intel Overclocking Utility set it for 4.8 GHz and the score was much improved. I used Userbenchmark.com. I'm using Hisense 43r6e HDR 4k as my monitor and once I got the HDMI 2.0 the HDR symbol showed on the screen. You have to enable/disable in Display and non HDR material  including your desktop will look bad. However, any HDR material including games will look amazing. Keep in mind the nits on my TV is only 296 (SDR=100) on a high-end >1000 nit screen it would be truly astounding.  Call of Duty: Warzones has ray-tracing and also look great. Kept up over 60fps with some dialing back of the settings. World of Warcraft : Battle for Azeroth played ultra settings  ~70 - 120 fps in game.  Overclocking did very little (around 1.5 fps maybe) but increased my CPU temp from normal 56 C to almost 80 degrees C. I also noticed that while idle the cpu will Turboboost  to 4.8MHz but when streaming Youtube or gaming the CPU never went over 3.6GHz unless manually set with the Overclocking Utility. Overall, I am extremely happy with my purchase especially now that I am stuck at home and I have to somehow occupy myself. I might add one more fan on the top of the unit, but so far it hasn't gotten too hot when heavily tasked.Fast, looks great, quiet, all for a nice price and no hassles right out of the box!

So overall this is a good pc. My only two issues with this machine is that the included AIO single fan cooler for the model with the 2080 super, i7 9700k doesnt feel as good. Just received it from UPS, packaging was good with no visible damage. Shipping speed was very fast. Very very little assembly is required. I followed the quick start directions and had no issues. I NEVER write reviews on Amazon, after 4 years of ordering off Amazon, this will be my first Product Review. Was worried about buying a prebuilt, but worries were for nothing.  This PC hits 100FPS with everything I have thrown at it and is whisper quiet. Grate for the first PC for I ever own! I had for a few months now and hadn't had any significant problems. The only downsides I had was some chipping on the corners of the tower's cover, probably from how it was handled in transit, the power cord for it wasn't working well at all, and the Internet had issues. I had to buy another power cord for the pc to use and toss the one it came with to the trash, which is an inconvenience for me when you spend so much money on a PC and don't expect to pay more to fix issues that it has.Regardless all was as advertised, runs smoothly, has a quiet hum when running. The LED lights are something fun to play with. I enjoy it very much.

I bought this to upgrade to an faster 8-core i7 processor with AVX2 support and a faster graphics card.I work as a graphic artist/retoucher, so my main use is for work rather than gaming but this computer has all the features I need at a great price. The fact that it looks killer cool is a nice bonus.

Imagine my excitement when this brand new beast of a machine showed up at my door. Hooked everything up and pressed the power button and.. nothing. That's the instant I knew I made a mistake buying a PC on Amazon built by a third party. In the past, I've purchased directly from CyberpowerPC and never had a single bad thing to say but these guys are allowing a third party to make them look bad. Yes, it's about $400 cheaper than buying directly from CyberpowerPC but playing the brand lottery is not worth the potential headaches and the possibility of having to return and wait for a refund or replacement. I took it apart many times and finally it powered on randomly. Worked great for 12 days but then randomly wouldn't power on again. Came to the conclusion it must be faulty power supply or faulty power button. I've had the PC less than 2 weeks! Save yourself the headache of this thing quitting on you outside of warranty and purchase directly from CyberpowerPC.

I had the machine reviewed by a computer shop I know that has repaired hard drives and other issues for me in the past. It was indeed a new machine with new parts and they didn't see any heating problems or loose connections or noise issues at all.I haven't run it yet and I expect it will do fine. I don't have any serious concerns at this point. there are a couple of things that should be pointed out. The machine arrived with subpar documentation. In fact, a dvd allegedly provided drivers and a manual for a completely different version of the MOBO even though the machine itself has no dvd drive. The MOBO is an ASROCK Phantom Gaming 4-CB which is custom made for Cyberpower and may have issues for updating the BIOS. There is an updated BIOS driver available from Cyberpower but it's not clear whether that's going to apply to this machine since the update was May 2019.

This machine is an absolute beast!  I've thrown everything at it and it barely bats an eye, consistently getting over 150fps with max settings in the latest games (Apex,COD:Warzone,Tera,PUBG).  My parts lottery landed me with an Asus Dual 2070 Super 8GB OC Edition, super excited about that!  The aesthetics of this PC are excellent with great cable management (although I may replace the ketchup and mustard cables with custom power supply sleeved cable extensions).  The RGB on this is very pretty to look at and the included remote works as expected.  I may purchase a magnetic RGB strip for some extra lighting.  This rig was ready to go right out of the box, I didn't need to install anything other than the video card drivers.  I have absolutely zero complaints with this purchase and am looking forward to many many hours of high def gaming.

After one week of owning the computer, the processor would reach almost 100 degrees celsius on intense gaming before completely switching off my GPU drivers and the fans speeding up like crazy. I play a fair number of games and I was blessed with a bonus check this Christmas. I went from playing my favorite games in 1280x720 to 2560x1440. All I can say is that I will never go back. My system came in in good condition and worked out of the box.  The cabling was neat but not exactly accurate.  The fans was all connected to one source that prevents you from controlling them individually.  Eventually I will buy more fans and fix that.  All of the games I play runs great.  Examples: Forza Horizon 4 runs on Ultra above 4k and average a solid 70 to 80 fps.  Destiny 2 4k most settings Ultra a solid 60fps.  Division 2 Ultra at an 85% resolution scale hits 50 to 60, I don't notice any drops because I have an LG B9 that does G-sync and VRR.  The only game that I have that really struggles is Anthem that requires me to drop the resolution to around 1600p to get a solid 60.The main problem is the parts that you can't select.  My system came with a Zotec RTX 2070 Super mini which has fans that is always running so even 7 feet away and just browsing the web I can still hear it.  Other brands of RTX 2070's like EVGA or MSI can have a lower fan curve to lower the sound of the card.  The motherboard is a  Asrock Z390 Phantom Gaming 4-CB.  Which is a decent board that supports SLI and 2 NVME drives but bios updates and the like is not supported by Asrock as the CB part of the name means it is a Cyber Power custom board.  All in all a good system for those that don't want to build there own or don,t know how to.  Just be aware that people will have different experiences because of the random selection of parts.

The machine had everything I wanted. Unfortunately, I waited 2 weeks for a machine that wouldn't even POST. The box had power- all of the fans spooled up -- except for the RTX 2070's. It showed no signs of life, and no video signal was coming off of it from DP or HDMI. I even took out the card and re-seated it. Nada.  Also, the "lighted" RGB case fans didn't ever light. They spooled up, but no lights of any kind.Ultimately, this ended up being a $1400 air filter.

Let me tell you something - this PC is a beast. I got it today, and it’s running every game 4k around 80fps; no problem. Not only does it perform, but it gives looks. This alleviated the awful internet speed, and started running as I previously mentioned. All in all, I am very content with my purchase, and I know you will to. Hope you have a great rest of your day! Thank you, CyberPower!

I have been building my own PCs since the late 80s.  When I compared the cost of building my own vs purchasing this machine it seemed obvious that I should go with the pre-built CyberPowerPC. I was initially worried reading that the parts received would be a "mixed bag" so to speak of what would be in the build but am pretty pleased with what I got. Computer arrived on time and was well packaged. Computer is fast and quite. This thing runs really cool compared to my old one that I built. YOU GUYS!! Okay, so this was an impulse buy. BUT THIS THING IS A MONSTER! I waited... and waited.. because I wanted to decide if I should or not HOWEVER!!, I AM SO GLAD I DID! I am impressed with quality of the product for the price.  All the computers in my home are from Cyberpower and some of them are as old as 9 years. LED lighting that you can customize, liquid cooled, SSD, and exceptional Video card.

After contemplating building a pc for a long time I finally splurged and bought this as it was cheaper to buy this prebuild than to build it myself. Not a computer guy at all so I’m probably a terrible judge but I will say for anyone that knows nothing about PCs this is a pretty sweet set up.  Very easy to set up and ran fine out of the box I did install some software and update drivers for gpu and motherboard. Playing call of duty on a 4K monitor this things does get a little warmer than I’d like. All of the fans on my unit were set to exhaust so I switched the front two around to draw in cooler air and bought some magnetic dust filters running much cooler now and overall I’m blown away at how much better games like destiny two and elder scrolls look on this thing

This PC runs very smoothly and is a great value for the price! I had been looking to buy a PC for awhile when I came across this one. I absolutely love the RGB and that it is controllable by the remote.  It is very clean and the cable management is great. It was also nice that it came with a keyboard and mouse. Photoshop runs very smoothly and quickly. Gaming is great on this PC as well. All my games run smoothly with no problems. The only problem I had was with shipping. I was sent a product with a broken case, but I contacted Amazon and they sent me a new one and even picked up the broken one. Cyberpower also had great customer service. I highly recommend it.

So I was trying to upgrade my first gaming Pc which had a 7th generation I5 and a radeon rx 580 graphics card. Long story short, I would have been buying all the separate parts of a new pc so I decided to just go with another Pre-built. 3 months in and I still completely love it. When I got this Pc, it was around $1500 after taxes, and I honestly can't complain. With the RTX 2070 super and the i7-9700K alone make it worth the price. Finally, I haven't had any problems with overheating. I don't know much about liquid cooling, but even when playing cpu intensive games, I haven't gone above 75C. Overall, 10/10 would recommend.
Overall a good purchase but be prepared to replace the PSU.I had the computer less than month give or take and the power supply already failed.

Dislikes: Graphics card didn't work, had to remove and re-seat in order to get it operational. 2 USB 3.0 ports on the top of the PC didn't work. This will be my gaming rig, just received it yesterday. Shipped really quickly and arrived in perfect condition.  Started right up & ran beautifully right out of the box. I was looking to build a video editing PC (DaVinci Resolve) when I found this one with pretty similar specs and two bonuses.....already built and a better price. The box came all bang-up, understandably is not their fault. I'm rewriting my entire review, now that I have a better understanding of PC's/Computers.Fair warning to first timers; Don't worry about the "Addressable RGB chip." Definitely would recommend

I am heavily involved in the flight simulation community.  Six years ago I acquired a PC that, at that time, was very capable of providing the frames and graphics for the programs that I was using.  But with most computer programs, the graphics exploded from megabythes to gigabythes.  I was looking for a gaming computer with the all of the interface components that would bring me up to date.  After months of research, I basically trusted my faith that I had in Amazon's quality products.After 2 months, this computer has been everything that I had hoped it would be.  I am very satisfied with this PC and would most likely purchase from this company again.

I bought this as a replacement/upgrade and was not disappointed. Boots up fast, video card is great, and the fans are very quiet. I read other people's issues and had bought a spare wireless adapter and extra fans, anticipating issues. So far I have been fortunate in that there was no major problems. I did have an initial scare when inspecting to make sure everything was plugged in; I had no idea that the SSD was this tiny stick flush against the motherboard and panicked when I thought they 'forgot' to include it. Of course, it booted windows fine indicating the SSD was in fact present.While I was able to install a fan in the bottom of the case to 'suck' in cold air, the liquid cooling system's fan doesn't leave room to add an exhaust fan in the top grate. After some time with this pc I have changed my mind with how I look at it. First, I don't recommend buying this pc unless you have extra money to purchase more stuff like a better motherboard and more ram that is faster. After about 6 - 8 months with this pc, I have started finding many problems with it like the motherboard just stopped working so I had to spend another $300 on a new motherboard ( You don't have to spend that much but I just wanted something that is a lot better ). Second, for me 16 gigs of ram is not enough so I bought another 16 gigs of ram but I recommend that you purchase new ram that is around 3200mhz because I think 2400mhz is very slow.Pros:

Called cyber power pc customer service before and after buying at your amazon store page. Great phone service. bought item and amazon shipped it in 3 days not a scratch on orange box. every thing was well labeled and setup was very easy. THE ONLY BAD THING WAS BOTH STICKS OF RAM WAS LAYING ON BOTTOM OF PC CASE. :( Installed rem and it booted up no problems. In bios cpu fan setting for cpu water pump was set to monitor motherboard not cpu temps. so after 1 hour cpu was running a little hot. No problem i fixed that.side note. Apevia rgb fans on water pump radiator are not pwm fans !!! Will not push proper air flow through radiator. i pulled the rgb case fand off of radiator an relocated them to other case fan locations in pc case. and installed noctua pwm fan. now the cpu is icy cold under load and your colorful rgb case fans are keeping the inside pc case cool under load also. Ok so my mom allays said never give someone a 5 out of five rating because everyone always have room for improvement. BUT YOU GUYS REALLY NAILED IT ON CUSTOMER SERVICE. Thank you.

When I first received this PC I gave it a decent review based on my first impressions. After owning it for a little over a month I just had to come back to my previous review now that I’ve gotten to know this machine a little better. When I first received this computer it looked to be of decent quality but you pull the back off and that’s where you really have to ask yourself if buying prebuilt is really any better than hand selecting the components for your own build. When pricing the components in this build out, I could have made it for less if you have the time to look around and shop for the best deal. I know that not everyone can do that but the option is there. The cable management was abysmal with all the cables made into a ball right in front of the power supply and this case is quite hard to move around in so you would really have to unhook everything just to rewire what you already paid someone else to do. When I first turned it on, I had power but nothing wags on the display. Come to find out the GPU was plugged in but not at the power supply which meant having to weed through a pile of cables in a space where I could barely fit my hand in. Once that was fixed it worked no no problem until the CPU started to heat up and the one of the fans sounded like it was grinding up against the radiator. I turned the computer off and contacted CyberpowerPC about the fan issue and they said it would be sent out right away. Unfortunately they are located in California and shipping the fan took over a month. I contacted CyberpowerPC on November 14, 2019 and I just received the fan late last week (December 19, 2019). In the meantime I had bought another fan and put it in and figured I would swap the fans when the replacement from California would get here. I swap it out, and that fan is a dud too. I find myself incredibly frustrated with the situation and I’m writing this as a reminder to anyone, if it doesn’t work when you turn it on just return it and let them deal with the headache. Luckily I am still able to return this item and that’s what I intend on doing. I believe CyberpowerPC has a good reputation and a following based on who uses their PC’s but having someone wait around for almost 5 weeks for a fan replacement is insane. I’ll be returning tomorrow and starting off on my own build!
